Text:
♪ if I had a heart
I could love you ♪

♪ If I had a voice
I would sing ♪

♪ After the night
when I wake up ♪

♪ if I had a voice
I would sing ♪

I'm taking Bjorn
to the thing tomorrow.

Not yet.
He's not old enough.

He'll need a silk ribbon,
Lagertha.
Don't sleep with lots of women in kattegat.

I can do without it
for a few days.

Is that another way
of saying you love me?

I dreamt you were feeding me
blood pudding.

It means you're giving me
your heart.
The earl will deal with some criminal offenses
And then, we'll discuss the summer raids.
He'll send us to the east,
As always, to the baltic lands.

But I want to know
what is to the west -

What cities and gods
are over there.

See, I'm not satisfied...
With this.

Odin gave his eye
to acquire knowledge,
But I would give far more.

And will earl haraldson
let you?
We know you're all alone here.

If you're thirsty,
I will give you a drink.

If you're hungry,
I will feed you.

After we've satisfied
our other needs.
I don't want to kill you, woman.

If you tried
for a hundred years.
I went to confess my love to her
But I was set upon by a bear
And an enormous hound who guarded her home.
I killed the bear with my spear

And I managed
to strangle the hound

And that is how I gained
her hand in marriage.

Did she tell you
the same story?
Are you ready to receive your arm ring
And what does a man do?

Could you look after
our family?

What do you mean?
You look after us.
I have a big decision to make.
You have a big day tomorrow.

By frey and all the gods
how you've grown.
Are you here for the thing?

Why don't you go
lie down?

So where do you think the earl
is going to send us this year?
Are as poor as we are.
That's why we should sail west.

Great towns, and cities,
and treasures;

Hordes of gold and silver,
and... And a new god.

We can't sail across
an open ocean.

I believe there's a way
to go west.

I have something
that will change everything.
A while back, I met someone,
He told me that it was possible
To go west, over the open sea,
It needs to sit in water.
Now tell me, Ragnar, this-this wanderer of yours,

Has he ever sailed
west himself?

The sun rises up into the sky
until noon.
At noon, it is at its shortest.

That only tells me
how far south I have travelled.

Didn't I just tell you
to listen?!
You mark a circle around the pointer

Where the shadow
is at its shortest at noon.

You place the board
back into water around noon
If the shadow only touches the circle...

And if it passes outside
the circle, like this...

And you must steer
further south.

And what if it never
reaches the circle?

And must steer more
to the north.

Keep the noon shadow
on the circle
And your course will be true,

But what if there is
no sun?

How can the board
help you then?
How could you find your way?

You have pleaded guilty
to the charge of stealing.
Tomorrow, you will run a gauntlet of stones and turf
Let it be known a fine is to be paid

By anyone who fails
to throw something.

You are accused of the murder
of sigvald strut

To the first person
that you met afterwards,

In fact, you passed by
several houses

I thought the relatives
of the dead man
The law allows you to pass two houses

You murdered my brother
in cold blood!

We argued about
some disputed land.

You wanted that land
for yourself!

- Who says I'm a coward?
- I'm not a coward!
As the normal procedures were not followed,

This killing cannot be
atoned for

Murder is a dishonorable deed
amongst our people.
To a series of revenge killings

That would involve
your own family.
Lord, you knew about that land.
You knew I had a claim to it-
I ask you to look to the accused.
If you think that he is guilty,
You have been found guilty of murder.
How do you wish to die?

After which we will shall feast
and talk about the summer raids.

He wants to die well,
without fear,
You must watch, for his sake.
It's his only hope of reaching valhalla.

May he never feast
with the gods.

He should not have
done that.
Someone told me he wanted that land for himself

And he knew Trygvasson
had the best claim to it,

This how things are done
around here.

May you accept this gift
of salt and earth

That you belong to both
the land and the sea.

These arm rings bind you
in loyalty to me,
Any oath that you swear on these rings
Do you understand and swear to this?

And do you freely
give your fealty to me,
You may put on the arm rings.
But we also want to know

Where we will be raiding
this summer.
We have a right to know.
We will raid east again, to the eastlands,
We go to the same places!

I have heard of these rumors,
these stories;
That we will somehow reach a land

But I tell you that
I will not risk my ships

They are my ships -
I pay for them -

And they go where
I tell them to go.

Now that's the end
of the matter.
Earl Haraldson wants to speak with you -
You want to feast in my hall?
You want to sail in my ships?
Anything else you want from me?

You keep talking about
the west -
What do you know of it?

That it's a land
of great riches?
I don't care what you believe.
And not for the first time,

But, believe me,
it will be the last.

You should be content
with your lot.

Farms are few
and in great demand,
And there are many people here

Who would like to possess
your land.

Do you understand
what I'm saying?

Then don't ever stick your nose
in my face again.

I don't trust him.
Watch him.
Where are we going now? I'm so tired.

- Why don't you come in?
- I'm waiting.

I want to know
what the gods have in store.

The gods desire you
to have a great future.

But they can withdraw
their goodwill

You must convince the gods
to alter the runes
So they work in your favor.

Are far below the workings
and shapings of the gods.

So I should take
the laws of men
Well, then go and ask the gods yourself.

You haven't helped me at all,
ancient one.

Perhaps you asked
the wrong questions.

We have someone special
to visit.

Why didn't he come
to the thing?
It means he will be like you,

And therefore he will want
to do better than you,
And you will hate him for it.

How can you tell that
by just looking at my face?

I can tell which trees
will make the best planks
I can look inside the tree.

Inside this tree are two
almost perfect planks.
From the thighs to the back.

When I split this tree
I will find them.

Do you imagine ships
are just dead things?
It will be lighter and carry a bigger sail.

It's built with
a strong central plank.

The two strakes above it
are nailed

Directly onto the knees
of the frame.

Are cleated and lashed
onto the frames,

So they can move in relation
to each other.

This means the boat won't butt
against the waves like a goat,

But move over them
like a ripple.
The hull is deeper. How will my men set their oars?
I will cut them into the sheerstrakes,
And the ports can be closed when the boat is at sea.

And you think it could handle
long sea voyages?
But will it be strong enough?

We won't know that
until we try.

It's all I have left
from last summer's raids.

We'll soon be as rich
as dwarves!
Did anything happen while we were away?
My belly was empty of laughter.
You want me to make you laugh?
I don't want to laugh now.

I want to ride you,
like a bull.
I guess we'll have to wait.
Is your mother teaching you how to use a shield?

Yes, I know how
to use a shield.

Your mother was a famous
shield-maiden.

- But I'm a man.
- I have a ring.
I won't go under your command.

I won't go
unless we're all equal.
You and I will always be equal.
Then we must find a crew.

Not many men will go against
the wishes of Haraldson.

Some may even go to him
and betray us.

Yesterday, I was with a girl
from the town.

But when she shouted out
in pleasure,
I think about you all the time.
But perhaps not so great a man.

It made me certain
we're doing the right thing.
I shouldn't have pretended to build such a boat.

I've wasted all your money.
It was all a joke.
Now it runs on its cool keel.
I told you I could do it!

Now it's all up to you,
Ragnar Lothbrok.
